chapter.title: Printer Connection Types
chapter.para: Generally you can say, that the printer can be local or connected to another machine via network.

section.title: Local Printer
section.para: It means a printer that is connected to the machine's parallel or serial port, USB port or via the IrDA or Blootooth interface.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: Parport support module, lp module, proc filesystem support, parport_pc module in the kernel.

section.title: Autodetection of Devices
section.para: A list of parallel ports is in /proc/sys/dev/parport. The user must choose the port for adding a printer if there is more than one not autoprobed port.

section.title: Autoprobe of the Printer Model
section.para: If the printer conforms to the IEEE 1284 specification then hwinfo detects the printer vendor and model (and the device it is connected to).

section.title: Requirements
section.para: Serial port support module, proc filesystem support in the kernel.

section.title: Autodetection of Devices
section.para: A list of serial ports can be found in /proc/tty/driver/serial. The user must choose the port for adding a printer if there is more than one not autoprobed port.

section.title: Device Settings
section.para: User shoule be able to set baud rate, data bits, parity and ?flow control?. TODO it doesn't work!!!

section.title: Autoprobe of the Printer Model
section.para: Probing of printer connected via serial port is not supported (probably is not possible at all).

section.title: Requirements
section.para: USB support in kernel, usblp module loaded, hotplug

section.title: Autodetection of Devices
section.para: All /dev/usb/lp* are treated as possible devices. If CUPS is used as spooler, CUPS USB backend is used to probe URIs for queues.

section.title: Autoprobe of the Printer Model
section.para: Printer vendor and model are detected via hwinfo. In case of some printers (Epson USB printers) CUPS USB backend is used to detect the vendor and model (as hwinfo doesn't report the model correctly).

section.title: Requirements
section.para: IrDA properly configured and active

section.title: Autodetection of Devices
section.para: All /dev/irlpt* are treated as possible devices.

section.title: Autoprobe of the Printer Model
section.para: Probing of printer connected via serial port is not supported.

section.title: Remote Printer
section.para: It means printing on printers connected to a remote host with a spooler running ot the printer is connected directly to the network. The queues on the remote host should be already configured.

section.title: Required information
section.para: Name of the remote host, name of the remove queue

section.title: Autodetection of Hosts
section.para: Scan ports on remote machines

section.title: Autodetection of Queues
section.para: Not possible.

section.title: Required information
section.para: Name of the remote host, name of the remote queue

section.title: Autodetection of Hosts
section.para: Scan ports on the remote machines, check if the machine has at least one queue (via IPP protocol)

section.title: Autodetection of Queues
section.para: Via the IPP protocol.

section.title: Required information
section.para: Name of the remote host, name of the remote queue, name of the workgroup, user name and corresponding password

section.title: Autodetection of Hosts
section.para: Currently not supported

section.title: Autodetection of Workgroups
section.para: Currently not supported

section.title: Autodetection of Queues
section.para: Via nmblookup -A $HOST

section.title: Required information
section.para: Name of the remote host, name of the remote queue, user name and corresponding password

section.title: Autodetection of Hosts
section.para: A list of available NCP servers can be get using slist

section.title: Autodetection of Queues
section.para: A list of available queues on specified server can be get using pqlist.

section.title: Required information
section.para: Host name of the printer, port number

section.title: Autodetection of Hosts
section.para: Scan ports on remote machine

section.title: Autodetection of Port
section.para: Currently not supported
